noun.description: All existing matter and space considered as a whole; the cosmos. The universe is believed to be at least 10 billion light years in diameter and contains a vast number of galaxies; it has been expanding since its creation in the Big Bang about 13 billion years ago.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French univers or Latin universum, neuter of universus combined into one, whole, from uni- one + versus turned (past participle of vertere).
